title: Wildlife photography winner on show in London museum
text:
chinadaily.com.cn | Updated: 2019-10-17 08:11

They say a picture is worth a thousand words. If you went to London's Natural History Museum and saw this year's winner for Wildlife Photographer of the Year, you would think a picture is worth a thousand stories.



From China’s Qinghai province, photographer Bao Yongqing won the prize for his image The Moment, which shows a standoff between a Tibetan fox and a Himalayan marmot.



The Natural History Museum will be showing The Moment, as well as 99 other stunning photographs from Oct 18 to May 31.
